Description:
Merchant-assigned reference ID for the request.
If included in the request, this value is included in the response. This feature might be especially useful for multi-threaded applications.
This element contains a resultCode and one or more message elements.
States whether the request was handled successfully, or ended with an error.
Contains details about the result.

The code number for the result.
For a comprehensive list of possible values, or to look up a returned value, see the Response Code Tool.
Format: String, up to six characters.The first character is either an I for informational responses, or E for error responses. The remaining characters are numeric and indicate the type of informational or error response.

Description: Text explanation of the code for the result.
Contains information about the transaction.

The Authorize.net assigned identification number for a transaction.
Use this value to reference at a later time the transaction generated by this API call. You may need the transaction ID for follow-on transactions such as credits, voids, and captures of unsettled transactions, as well as for reporting calls.

The transaction ID of the original transaction.
This appears only for linked credits (transaction type refundTransaction).

Identifies the split tender order, if applicable.
This appears only for transactions that are part of a split tender purchase.
Date and time the transaction was submitted, expressed in UTC.

Date and time the transaction was submitted, in the merchant's time zone.
This element uses the merchant's time zone as configured in the Merchant Interface. If unconfigured, defaults to Mountain Time (UTC-7).
The type of transaction that was originally submitted.
Format: String.Either authCaptureTransaction, authOnlyTransaction, captureOnlyTransaction, or refundTransaction.

Description: The status of the transaction.
The overall status of the transaction.
Format: String.One of the following:1 -- Approved2 -- Declined3 -- Error4 -- Held for Review

Description:
A code that represents more details about the result of the transaction.
For a comprehensive list of possible values, or to look up a returned value, see the Response Code Tool.
A brief explanation of the responseReasonCode.
The authorization code granted by the card issuing bank for this transaction.
Address Verification Service (AVS) response code.
Format: String, 1 character.One of the following:A -- The street address matched, but the postal code did not.B -- No address information was provided.E -- The AVS check returned an error.G -- The card was issued by a bank outside the U.S. and does not support AVS.N -- Neither the street address nor postal code matched.P -- AVS is not applicable for this transaction.R -- Retry â€” AVS was unavailable or timed out.S -- AVS is not supported by card issuer.U -- Address information is unavailable.W -- The US ZIP+4 code matches, but the street address does not.X -- Both the street address and the US ZIP+4 code matched.Y -- The street address and postal code matched.Z -- The postal code matched, but the street address did not.

Description: Card code verification (CCV) response code.
Format: String, 1 character.One of the following:M -- CVV matched.N -- CVV did not match.P -- CVV was not processed.S -- CVV should have been present but was not indicated.U -- The issuer was unable to process the CVV check.

Description:
Cardholder authentication verification response code.
Important: Mastercard transactions always return a null result for this element. Consequently, transaction details for Mastercard transactions do not contain CAVV results.
Format: String, 1 character.One of the following:Blank or not present -- CAVV not validated.0 -- CAVV was not validated because erroneous data was submitted.1 -- CAVV failed validation.2 -- CAVV passed validation.3 -- CAVV validation could not be performed; issuer attempt incomplete.4 -- CAVV validation could not be performed; issuer system error.5 -- Reserved for future use.6 -- Reserved for future use.7 -- CAVV failed validation, but the issuer is available. Valid for U.S.-issued card submitted to non-U.S acquirer.8 -- CAVV passed validation and the issuer is available. Valid for U.S.-issued card submitted to non-U.S. acquirer.9 -- CAVV failed validation and the issuer is unavailable. Valid for U.S.-issued card submitted to non-U.S acquirer.A -- CAVV passed validation but the issuer unavailable. Valid for U.S.-issued card submitted to non-U.S acquirer.B -- CAVV passed validation, information only, no liability shift.

Description:
The action applied to the transaction by the merchant's Advanced Fraud Detection Suite settings.
When multiple filters apply to a transaction, we will take the most restrictive action. For example, if a transaction triggers two AFDS filters, and one filter returns hold while the other filter returns reject, we will reject the transaction instead of holding it.

Contains information for any fraud filters that have been applied.
Since one transaction may trigger more than one filter, you will receive each filter that the transaction triggered, along with the action specified by the filter.
Contains information for one fraud filter.
Name of the fraud filter.
The setting for the filter.
Contains information about the transaction.
Merchant-defined invoice number associated with the order.Worldpay RAFT 610 merchants can view the invoice number in the Worldpay Reporting Portal.
Description of the item purchased.
The merchant-assigned purchase order number.

Amount requested in original authorization.
Present if the current transaction is for a prepaid card or if a splitTenderId value was sent.
Format: Decimal, up to 15 digits with a decimal point.Do not use currency symbols.For example, 8.95.

Description: The amount authorized or refunded by the original transaction..
Format: Decimal, up to 15 digits with a decimal point.Do not use currency symbols.For example, 8.95.

Description:
The amount that was submitted for settlement.
This will equal the value of authAmount in most cases. For voided transactions, we will return a value of "0.00". For transactions captured after an intitial authOnlyTransaction request, the value may be less than authAmount if the full amount wasn't captured.
Format: Decimal, up to 15 digits with a decimal point.Do not use currency symbols.For example, 8.95.

Description: Contains information about the batch if the transaction is settled. This will not be present for unsettled transactions.
The identification number for the batch.
Date and time when the batch was settled, expressed in UTC.

Date and time when the batch was settled, expressed in merchantâ€™s local time zone.
This element returns the time in the merchant time zone as set in the Merchant Interface.To update the time zone, log in to the Merchant Interface and click Account > Settings > Time Zone.
Status of the batch.
Contains information about applicable taxes.

Amount of tax.
The total transaction amount must include this value.
Format: Decimal, up to four decimal places.

Description: Name of tax.
Description of tax.
Contains information about any duty applied.

Amount of duty.
The total transaction amount must include this value.
Format: Decimal, up to four decimal places.

Description: Name of duty.
Description of duty.
Items in this element describe shipping charges applied.

Amount of the shipping charges.
The total transaction amount must include this value.
Format: Decimal, up to four decimal places.

Description: Name of the shipping charges.
Description of the shipping charges.
Contains one or more lineItem elements, up to a maximum of 30 line items.
Contains information about one item.
Item identification.
The human-readable name for the item.
A description of the item.
The quantity of items sold.
Format: Decimal, up to four decimal places.

Description: The cost per unit, excluding tax, freight, and duty.
Format: Decimal, up to four decimal places.

Description: Indicates whether the item is taxable.

The amount remaining on the prepaid card at the time of the transaction.
This element is provided only for prepaid card transactions.
Format: Decimal, up to four decimal places.

Description: Indicates whether the item is tax exempt.
This element contains payment information.
This element is not returned if payment was by bank account.
The masked card number used for the transaction.
The masked expiration date for the card.
Type of credit card.
Format: String.Either Visa, Mastercard, Discover, AmericanExpress, DinersClub, or JCB.

Description: This element is not returned if payment was by credit card.
The masked ABA routing number.
The masked bank account number.
Name of the person who holds the bank account.
The type of eCheck transaction.
Format: String.Either PPD, WEB, CCD, TEL, ARC, or BOC.

Description: The following fields contain customer information.
Type of customer.

The unique customer ID used to represent the customer associated with the transaction.
If you use customer IDs, your solution should generate the customer ID and send it with your transaction requests. Authorize.net does not generate customer IDs.
Format: String, up to 20 characters.Use alphanumeric characters only, without spaces, dashes, or other symbols.

Description:
Conditional.The customerâ€™s valid email address.
Required only when using a European payment processor.If you enable Email Receipts in the Merchant Interface, and if the email address format is valid, the customer will receive an Authorize.net generated email receipt.
Contains the billing address information.
The first name associated with the customer's billing address.
The last name associated with the customer's billing address.
The company name associated with the customer's billing address.
The customer's billing address.
The city of the customer's billing address.
The state or province of the customer's billing address.
Format: String, up to 40 characters.For US states, use the USPS two-character abbreviation for the state.

Description: The postal code for the customer's billing address.
Country of customerâ€™s billing address.
Format: String, up to 60 characters.Use the ISO 3166 alpha-2 code for the country.

Description: Phone number associated with customerâ€™s billing address.
Fax number associated with customerâ€™s billing address.
Contains the shipping address information.
First name associated with customerâ€™s shipping address.
Last name associated with customerâ€™s shipping address.
Company associated with customerâ€™s shipping address.
Customerâ€™s shipping address.
City of customerâ€™s shipping address.
State of customerâ€™s shipping address.
Format: String, up to 40 characters.For US states, use the USPS two-character abbreviation for the state.

Description: Postal code of customerâ€™s shipping address.
Country of customerâ€™s shipping address.
Indicates whether or not this is a recurring transaction.
This element is a container for one or more returnedItem fields. Applies only to eCheck.Net transactions.
Contains fields that contain returned item information.
Transaction ID.
Date and time the item was returned, in UTC.

Date and time the item was returned, in the merchant's time zone.
This element uses the merchant's time zone as configured in the Merchant Interface. If unconfigured, defaults to Mountain Time (UTC-7).

The ACH return code.
To view a list of return codes, see our Testing Guide.
A text description of the reason for the return.
Contains information about the software that generated the transaction.

The unique Solution ID which you generate and associate with your solution through the Partner Interface.
See the Solution ID Implementation Guide for details.

The name of the solution which submitted this transaction.
See the Solution ID Implementation Guide for details.

The name of the vendor which created the solution.
See the Solution ID Implementation Guide for details.

The IPv4 address of the customer initiating the transaction. Defaults to 255.255.255.255 if not included in your request.
Required only when the merchant is using customer IP based AFDS filters.
Format: String, up to 15 characters.Use dot-decimal formatting.

Description: The network transaction ID generated by the card network if made available by the processor.

The network transaction ID returned in response to the original card-on-file transaction.
Store the networkTransId value received in the original card-on-file transaction response. Set the originalNetworkTransId to the original networkTransId value for all subsequent authorizations against the same card-on-file.

The authorized amount for the original card-on-file transaction.
Store the amount of the original card-on-file transaction response. Set the originalAuthAmount to the original amount value for all subsequent authorizations against the same card-on-file.
Format: Decimal, up to 15 digits with a decimal point.Do not use currency symbols.

Description:
Indicates whether the authorization was a pre-authorization or final authorization.
Applicable to Mastercard only. Use pre for initial authorizations, for example, prior to tips. Use final for final authorizations, for example, including tips.
Contains subscription information.
The subscription ID.

Identifies the number of this transaction, in terms of how many transactions have been submitted for this subscription.
For example, the third transaction processed for this subscription will return payNum set to 3.
The market type of the transaction.
Indicates whether the card was present for the transaction.
Format: String. Either Card Not Present or Card Present.

Description: The unique identifier of the mobile device.
Contains customer profile information used for this transaction.
The ID number associated with the customer profile.
The ID of the customer payment profile used to charge this transaction.
The name of the SDK used to generate the transaction, if using an SDK.

Merchant-assigned reference ID for the request.
If your request included refId, we will return the value in transrefId. This feature might be especially useful for multi-threaded applications.
